Add the Associated Values to a Cast Tab

Source: R/process_casts.R
add-to-cast-tab.Rd

Add values to a cast's cast tab. If necessary components are missing (such as no observations added yet and the user requests errors), the missing components are added.

add_lead_to_cast_tab adds a column of lead times.

add_obs_to_cast_tab appends a column of observations.

add_err_to_cast_tab adds a column of raw error values.

add_covered_to_cast_tab appends a logical column indicating if the observation was within the prediction interval.

add_lead_to_cast_tab(
  main = ".",
  settings = directory_settings(),
  cast_tab = NULL
)

add_err_to_cast_tab(
  main = ".",
  settings = directory_settings(),
  cast_tab = NULL
)

add_covered_to_cast_tab(
  main = ".",
  settings = directory_settings(),
  cast_tab = NULL
)

add_obs_to_cast_tab(
  main = ".",
  settings = directory_settings(),
  cast_tab = NULL
)

Arguments

main

character value of the name of the main component of the directory tree.

settings

list of controls for the directory, with defaults set in directory_settings that should generally not need to be altered.

cast_tab

A data.frame of a cast's output. See read_cast_tab.

Value

data.frame of cast_tab with an additional column or columns if needed.

Details

If an interpolated data set is used to fit a model, add_obs_to_cast_tab adds the true (non-interpolated) observations so that model predictions are all compared to the same data.

Contents

Developed by Juniper L. Simonis, Glenda M. Yenni, Ellen K. Bledsoe, Erica M. Christensen, Henry Senyondo, Hao Ye, Ethan P. White, S.K. Morgan Ernest.
